timeline.bodyText: I think it should be boolean, with the defaultValue=false
timeline.author: sberyozkin

replies.bodyText: My rational here was that the user may want to force false. It can be strange to define the value as false, and in fact becoming true because the conditions match. No? I guess if it's documented there is no problem.
replies.author: mcserra

replies.bodyText: Ok, cool :) So you want me to revert it?
replies.author: mcserra

timeline.bodyText:
I'm trying to figure out how to change either the docs or the defaultValueDocumentation and I'm getting confused for the 3rd time :-).
OK, so, if this property is false (which is a default value of this property) then Access-Control-Allow-Credentials is false unless a matching non-wildcard Origins is present.
It feels it would be less confusing if we remove this defaultValueDocumentation and instead add to the javaDocs:
The value of this header will be set to `true` if either this property is set to `true` or `quarkus.http.cors.origins` property is set and does not include '*' which will require a precise `Origin` header check.

How does it sound ?
timeline.author: sberyozkin
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -61,6 +61,14 @@
     @ConfigItem
     public Optional<Duration> accessControlMaxAge;
 
+    /**
+     * The `Access-Control-Allow-Credentials` header is used to tell the
+     * browsers to expose the response to front-end JavaScript code when
+     * the request’s credentials mode Request.credentials is “include”.
+     */
+    @ConfigItem(defaultValueDocumentation = "Default value is true when origins is present and does not include '*', else it is false")

timeline.bodyText: Can you also have a boolean var recording the result of the origin comparison checked here ? It is probably not very critical but it is better to return true only if the exact origin match happened...
timeline.author: sberyozkin
